climatePledgeFriendly.details: Compact by Design (Certified by Amazon) products remove excess air and water, which reduces the carbon footprint of shipping and packaging.

features: UNSCENTED BABY WIPES: Burt's Bees Baby unscented, no-rinse baby wipes gently cleanse baby's hands, feet and face leaving your little one clean and ready for the next adventure
SOOTHING INGREDIENTS: Hypoallergenic baby face wipes have a cloth-like texture and are lovingly infused with aloe and vitamin E to help calm and soothe baby's sensitive skin
NATURAL FORMULA: Cleanse your little one's sticky messes effortlessly with baby hand and face wipes that are formulated with 98.5% natural origin and nourishing ingredients
CONVENIENT CLEANSING: Perfect for mamas on the go, these pre-moistened wipes are a baby essential and come in a resealable pouch to clean and freshen your little one's skin with ease

NO ADDITIVES: Accepted by the National Eczema Association and Pediatrician tested, these wipes are formulated without parabens, phthalates, SLS, petrolatum or synthetic fragrances and are safe on sensitive skin and eczema prone skin
body.description: Pre moistened natural cleaning cloths designed to gently clean and moisturize your babys skin while on the go or at home. These soft fragrance free wipes are made with soothing aloe and vitamin E to moisturize, calm and aid in soothing the skin. Leave your little ones skin clean and feeling soft and smooth. Burts Bees Baby Face & Hand Cloths are 99.1% natural, hypoallergenic and made without parabens, phthalates, petrolatum or SLS. Nurture babys skin naturally with Baby Bee from Burts Bees.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Bath Time Our Bubble Bath and tear-free Shampoo & Wash make bath time fun and safe. Diaper Duty Wipes, Multi-Purpose Ointments and Talc-Free Dusting Powder go easy on your baby’s bottom. Everyday Care Designed with you baby's skin in mind, our Nourishing Lotion keeps delicate skin soft and comforted. Formula & Remedies Nourish your baby with USDA Organic formulas inspired by breast milk, and find soothing solutions with nature-inspired remedies.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for a baby with sensitive skin
reviews.reviewText: These are so essential for everything baby-related! My daughter has super sensitive skin and normal baby wipes caused irritation. These did not. She loves playing with the little plastic door where "the bee lives" (a bee sticker inside). Light and pleasant scent, high quality I've come to expect from Burt's Bees. I use them to clean her up after a snack as well as her toys, high chair, other things she comes in contact with that I don't want to use regular cleaning products on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect accessory for the diaper bag.
reviews.reviewText: Perfect accessory to keep in diaper bag to wipe faces and hands when you are in a rush. I have 3 kids that are 3 and under and we are on the run a lot, so trying to keep their face and hands clean is not always easy and I don't like using plain baby wipes because it dries their skin out. These wipes work perfectly for that and it doesn't dry out their skin.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Unscented, easy to use, keeps your baby clean!
reviews.reviewText: These are great to wipe dirty hands and faces. We keep them by the high chair for easy clean up after meals, as well as in the diaper bag to take care of any stubborn drool or spit-up. I was previously using the Johnson and Johnson version, but my son would cry every time I used them on his face. He is fine with the Burt's Bees version. The J&J version has a very strong scent, which may have bothered him, so I like being able to use the unscented ones on him.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Don't smell great, and have black and brown specs all over them.
reviews.reviewText: There are reviews that cover this but they are buried by old 5 stars and I missed them.This item is not eligible for returns. Wipes are covered in black and brown specs, which I'm not sure are organic materials due to the nature of Burts Bees, or if they're compromised. I have done outside research on the wipes and cannot find any acknowledgement of this issue by Burts Bees, despite seeing similar reviews on Target and Burts Bees websites.The product is likely unscented with perfumes, as advertised, but the ingredients do not equal a pleasant smell.As these are not returnable to Amazon, I've thrown all three packs in the trash. I do not recommend this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I like these wipes a lot for my baby - they do not cause a reaction to her sensitive skin. They do smell a bit like hops

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great wipes, great deal.
reviews.reviewText: I really like these wipes. Out of 2-3 i tried, these smell the best. Even though they all say fragrance free, there is still a smell, and this is the only one i find pleasant.They wipe well and the pack is small enough to put into diaper bag.Burt's bee is generally a bit expensive, but this is a great deal if you can store 12 packs some place.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Natural, gentle and functional
reviews.reviewText: Ok yes, these cloths are more than wipes, but they treat baby skin like a charm. After day care a quick wipe down with these cloths leave baby smelling wonderful and I love the ingredients list. Worth the money just do not waste on baby bum :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Hard to use
reviews.reviewText: Nice and useful wipes but ridiculously difficult to get out of the package (Godspeed if you’re trying to do it one-handed while caring for a wiggly baby), and too expensive. Won’t be buying them again.
